test_cases.name: Format String
test_cases.details: It is possible to inject format string modifiers to the call of the function as a first parameter.

test_cases.name: Format String (Objective-C)
test_cases.details: It is possible to inject format string modifiers to Objective-C constructs.

test_cases.name: Format String
test_cases.details: It is possible to inject format string modifiers to the call of the function as a second parameter.

test_cases.name: Format String
test_cases.details: It is possible to inject format string modifiers to the call of the function as a third parameter.

test_cases.name: Format String
test_cases.details: It is possible to inject format string modifiers to the call of the function as a fourth parameter.

test_cases.name: Format String
test_cases.details: It is possible to inject format string modifiers to the call of the function as a fifth parameter.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (strcpy and variants)
test_cases.details: Source of 'strcpy' operation can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (strcat)
test_cases.details: Source of 'strcat' operation can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (strncpy)
test_cases.details: Potentially dangerous call to 'strncpy' function. Source and/or count controlled by untrusted input.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (strncat)
test_cases.details: Potentially dangerous call to 'strncat' function. Source and/or count controlled by untrusted input.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (memcpy and variants)
test_cases.details: Potentially dangerous call to 'memcpy' function. Source and/or count controlled by untrusted input.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (memmove and variants)
test_cases.details: Potentially dangerous call to 'memmove' function. Source and/or count controlled by untrusted input.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (strcpy_s variants)
test_cases.details: Potentially dangerous call to one of 'strcpy_s' functions. Source and/or count controlled by untrusted input.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (strcat_s variants)
test_cases.details: Potentially dangerous call to one of 'strcat_s' functions. Source and/or count controlled by untrusted input.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (gets)
test_cases.details: The application is using function "gets" which could cause buffer overflow vulnerability.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (scanf)
test_cases.details: The application is using function "scanf" which could cause buffer overflow vulnerability.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (fscanf)
test_cases.details: The application is using function "fscanf" which could cause buffer overflow vulnerability.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (sscanf)
test_cases.details: The application is using function "sscanf" which could cause buffer overflow vulnerability.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (sprintf)
test_cases.details: Source of 'sprintf' operation can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (memcpy_s and variants)
test_cases.details: Source of 'memcpy_s' operation or its variants can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (memmove_s and variants)
test_cases.details: Source of 'memmove_s' operation or its variants can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (snprintf)
test_cases.details: Source of 'snprintf' operation can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (vsprintf)
test_cases.details: Source of 'vsprintf' operation can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Buffer Overflow (vsnprintf)
test_cases.details: Source of and amount of data copied by 'vsnprintf' operation can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Command Injection
test_cases.details: Source of 'system' or 'popen' function can be controlled by user.

test_cases.name: Potential Null Pointer Dereference
test_cases.details: Possible dereference of a NULL pointer.

test_cases.name: Unchecked return value of scanf (and variants)
test_cases.details: Return value of the scanf or one of its variants is not validated.
